title: Weil's conjecture on Tamagawa numbers
summary: In mathematics, the Weil conjecture on Tamagawa numbers is the statement that the Tamagawa number Ï„ ( G ) {\displaystyle \tau (G)} of a simply connected simple algebraic group defined over a number field is 1. In this case, simply connected means "not having a proper algebraic covering" in the algebraic group theory sense, which is not always the topologists' meaning.
